title: Exeter ask Man City for bigger share of FA Cup money
summary: Exeter City Supporters' Trust calls on Manchester City to give the club a greater share of the gate receipts from Saturday's FA Cup tie.

title: Simon Yates announces shock retirement from cycling
summary: Two-time Grand Tour winner Simon Yates announces his retirement from cycling with immediate effect.

title: 'Hard to hear' fans call us dull and boring - Slot
summary: Arne Slot says it is "hard to hear" fans calling his Liverpool side dull and boring and while he does not "completely disagree" he insists he wants to play "attractive football".

title: Carrick and Solskjaer frontrunners for Man Utd caretaker role
summary: Michael Carrick and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer emerge as frontrunners to become Manchester United's caretaker manager until the end of the season.

title: Dell, HP, and Lenovo headed in the opposite direction to Apple with new laptop designs
summary: Itâ€™s been over a year since we first heard about Appleâ€™s plans for a total redesign of the MacBook Pro, and weâ€™re expecting to see the results later this year. While the Cupertino company is predictably expected to head even further down the path of thinner and sleeker laptops, itâ€™s interesting to â€¦

title: O'Neil succeeds Rosenior as Strasbourg manager
summary: Gary O'Neil is appointed Strasbourg manager after Liam Rosenior left the French Ligue 1 side to join Chelsea earlier this week.

title: Rowe targets new investment as Exeter post Â£10.3m loss
summary: Exeter chief executive Tony Rowe hopes a new investor will be in place this year after the company that controls the Chiefs posted more than Â£10m in losses.

title: Palace would sell Guehi in January at right price - Glasner
summary: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says the club could sell captain Marc Guehi this month if his asking price is met.

title: Bethell learnt from NZ mistake to reach century
summary: Jacob Bethell describes the "goosebump" moment of securing his first Test century, but says he used the disappointment of falling short of reaching the milestone in the Test series with New Zealand to ensure he stayed focused to get over the line on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: McCullum and Key will be given chance to retain England roles
summary: Head coach Brendon McCullum and director of cricket Rob Key will be given the chance to stay on and show they can improve the England set-up.

title: Red Rose Burton to lead PWR players board
